location.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国北京市中心
location.en: Center of Beijing, People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 坐落于中华人民共和国北京市中心，紫禁城的南端，是明清两代北京皇城的正门。始建于1417年，初名承天门，1651年更名为天安门。现为中华人民共和国的象征之一，被设计入国徽。
description.en: Located in the center of Beijing, People's Republic of China, at the southern end of the Forbidden City, it was the main gate of the Imperial City of Beijing during the Ming and Qing dynasties. First built in 1417 as Chengtianmen, it was renamed Tiananmen in 1651. It is now a symbol of the People's Republic of China and is featured on the national emblem.

description.zh-cn: 明代御用建筑匠师，天安门的设计者。
description.en: An imperial architect of the Ming dynasty who designed Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 明清两代的皇家城池，位于紫禁城之外、内城之内。
description.en: The royal city of the Ming and Qing dynasties, located outside the Forbidden City and inside the Inner City.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第三位皇帝，在其统治期间下令始建天安门（时称承天门）。
description.en: The third emperor of the Ming dynasty, during whose reign the construction of Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen) was ordered.

description.zh-cn: 明末民变领袖，1644年攻入北京后，在撤退前焚毁了包括承天门在内的宫殿和城楼。
description.en: A leader of a peasant rebellion in the late Ming dynasty who, after capturing Beijing in 1644, burned down palaces and city gates, including Chengtianmen, before retreating.

description.zh-cn: 清朝入关后的第一位皇帝，其统治期间下令重建承天门并更名为天安门。
description.en: The first emperor of the Qing dynasty after entering the Shanhai Pass, who ordered the reconstruction of Chengtianmen and its renaming to Tiananmen during his reign.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼
en: The Proclamation of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 1949年10月1日在天安门举行的中华人民共和国成立仪式。
description.en: The ceremony for the founding of the People's Republic of China, held at Tiananmen on October 1, 1949.

en: National Emblem of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的国家象征，其设计包含了天安门的图案。
description.en: The national symbol of the People's Republic of China, which incorporates the design of Tiananmen.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国国务院

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国国务院
en: State Council of the People's Republic of China

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的最高国家行政机关。
description.en: The chief administrative authority of the People's Republic of China.

zh-cn: 北京中轴线——中国理想都城秩序的杰作

description.zh-cn: 指北京自元大都、明清北京城以来北京城市东西对称布局建筑物的对称轴，天安门是其组成部分之一。2024年被列入世界遗产名录。
description.en: Refers to the symmetrical axis of buildings in Beijing since the Yuan, Ming, and Qing dynasties. Tiananmen is one of its components. It was inscribed on the World Heritage List in 2024.

description.zh-cn: 一项由联合国支持、联合国教育科学文化组织负责执行的国际公约，旨在保护对全世界人类都具有杰出普遍性价值的自然或文化处所。
description.en: An international convention supported by the United Nations and administered by UNESCO, aimed at protecting natural or cultural sites of outstanding universal value to humanity.

description.zh-cn: 1966年发生于中国河北省邢台地区的一系列强烈地震，对天安门的建筑结构造成了影响，是其1970年重建的原因之一。
description.en: A series of strong earthquakes that occurred in the Xingtai area of Hebei Province, China, in 1966. They affected the structure of Tiananmen and were one of the reasons for its reconstruction in 1970.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国国父。1928年，其肖像首次被悬挂于天安门城楼。
description.en: A Chinese revolutionary and the founding father of the Republic of China. In 1928, his portrait was hung on the Tiananmen gate for the first time.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国政治家及军事家，曾任国民政府主席。抗日战争胜利后，其肖像曾被悬挂于天安门城楼。
description.en: A Chinese politician and military leader who served as the Chairman of the Nationalist Government. After the victory in the Second Sino-Japanese War, his portrait was hung on the Tiananmen gate.

nodes.id: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)

zh-cn: 中华民国临时政府 (1937年—1940年)
en: Provisional Government of the Republic of China (1937–1940)

description.zh-cn: 日本在“七七事变”后于北平成立的傀儡政权。该政府曾在天安门城楼悬挂标语。
description.en: A puppet state established by Japan in Beiping after the Marco Polo Bridge Incident. This government hung slogans on the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国的开国领袖。自1949年起，其巨幅肖像一直悬挂于天安门城楼中央。
description.en: The founding father of the People's Republic of China. Since 1949, his large portrait has been hung in the center of the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 中国共产党的重要理论家和政治活动家，曾任新闻总署署长。他拟定了1949年开国大典时天安门城楼上的标语内容。
description.en: An important theorist and political activist of the Chinese Communist Party, who served as the head of the General Administration of Press and Publication. He drafted the content of the slogans on Tiananmen for the founding ceremony in 1949.

description.zh-cn: 苏联第二任最高领导人。1953年其逝世后，天安门城楼曾更换其肖像一天以示哀悼。
description.en: The second supreme leader of the Soviet Union. After his death in 1953, his portrait was hung on the Tiananmen gate for one day in mourning.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日向天安门毛泽东像泼洒颜料的三名青年之一。
description.en: One of the three young men who threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen on May 23, 1989.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日向天安门毛泽东像泼洒颜料的三名青年之一。
description.en: One of the three young men who threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen on May 23, 1989.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日向天安门毛泽东像泼洒颜料的三名青年之一。
description.en: One of the three young men who threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen on May 23, 1989.

description.zh-cn: 2007年5月12日以自制燃烧物投向天安门毛泽东像的男子。
description.en: A man who threw a self-made incendiary device at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen on May 12, 2007.

description.zh-cn: 2014年3月6日向天安门毛泽东像投掷墨水瓶的男子。
description.en: A man who threw an ink bottle at the portrait of Mao Zedong on Tiananmen on March 6, 2014.

nodes.id: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

zh-cn: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

description.zh-cn: 2013年10月28日，恐怖分子驾车冲撞天安门金水桥护栏并起火的事件。
description.en: An incident on October 28, 2013, where terrorists drove a vehicle into the guardrails of the Jinshui Bridge at Tiananmen, causing it to catch fire.

description.zh-cn: 清朝光绪帝的皇后，宣统帝的皇太后。1912年2月12日，她在天安门颁布了宣统帝退位诏书。
description.en: The empress of the Guangxu Emperor and the empress dowager of the Xuantong Emperor of the Qing dynasty. On February 12, 1912, she issued the Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 清朝末代皇帝，也是中国历史上最后一位皇帝。
description.en: The last emperor of the Qing dynasty and the last emperor of China.

en: Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor

description.zh-cn: 由隆裕太后于1912年2月12日颁布，宣告清朝皇帝溥仪退位的重要历史文件。
description.en: An important historical document issued by Empress Dowager Longyu on February 12, 1912, announcing the abdication of the Qing emperor Puyi.

nodes.id: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府 (1949年－1954年)

zh-cn: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府 (1949年－1954年)
en: Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China (1949–1954)

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国成立初期的最高国家权力机关。
description.en: The supreme state authority of the People's Republic of China in its early years.

description.zh-cn: 1966年至1976年在中国发生的一场政治运动。期间，毛泽东曾在天安门城楼八次接见红卫兵。
description.en: A political movement in China from 1966 to 1976. During this period, Mao Zedong received Red Guards eight times on the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命时期中国青年学生组成的群众性组织。
description.en: Mass organizations of young students in China during the Cultural Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 位于北京市中心的城市广场，是多个重要历史事件的发生地。
description.en: A city square in the center of Beijing, the site of many significant historical events.

description.zh-cn: 1919年5月4日发生在北京的一场以青年学生为主的爱国运动，是发生在天安门广场的重要历史事件之一。
description.en: A patriotic movement led by young students in Beijing on May 4, 1919, which is one of the important historical events that took place in Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 1976年4月5日，为悼念周恩来，大批群众在天安门广场集会，后被镇压。该事件发生在天安门广场。
description.en: On April 5, 1976, a large crowd gathered in Tiananmen Square to mourn Zhou Enlai, which was later suppressed. The incident occurred in Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 1989年春夏之交在中国北京发生的一系列由学生主导的示威活动，主要场地在天安门广场。
description.en: A series of student-led demonstrations in Beijing, China, in the spring and summer of 1989, primarily held in Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 2001年1月23日发生在天安门广场的自焚事件。
description.en: A self-immolation incident that occurred in Tiananmen Square on January 23, 2001.

description.zh-cn: 中华人民共和国发行的第二套人民币，其一元券的背面图案为天安门。
description.en: The second series of currency issued by the People's Republic of China. The reverse of its one-yuan note features Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 蒯祥是天安门（时称承天门）的设计者。
description.en: Kuai Xiang was the designer of Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen).

description.zh-cn: 天安门（时称承天门）在明朝永乐十五年（1417年）始建。
description.en: Tiananmen (then known as Chengtianmen) was first built in the 15th year of the Yongle reign of the Ming dynasty (1417).

description.zh-cn: 天安门是明清两代北京皇城的正门。
description.en: Tiananmen was the main gate of the Imperial City of Beijing during the Ming and Qing dynasties.

description.zh-cn: 1644年，李自成在撤离北京前焚毁了包括承天门（天安门前身）在内的建筑。
description.en: In 1644, Li Zicheng burned down buildings including Chengtianmen (the predecessor of Tiananmen) before evacuating Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 清顺治八年（1651年），承天门在废墟上被大规模改建，并更名为“天安门”。
description.en: In the 8th year of the Shunzhi reign of the Qing dynasty (1651), Chengtianmen was rebuilt on a large scale on its ruins and renamed 'Tiananmen'.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立典礼

description.zh-cn: 天安门是1949年10月1日中华人民共和国开国大典的举办地。
description.en: Tiananmen was the venue for the founding ceremony of the People's Republic of China on October 1, 1949.

description.zh-cn: 天安门的图案被设计入中华人民共和国国徽，成为其核心元素之一。
description.en: The image of Tiananmen was incorporated into the national emblem of the People's Republic of China, becoming one of its core elements.

relationships.source: 中华人民共和国国务院

description.zh-cn: 1961年，中华人民共和国国务院将天安门列入第一批全国重点文物保护单位。
description.en: In 1961, the State Council of the People's Republic of China listed Tiananmen as one of the first Major Historical and Cultural Sites Protected at the National Level.

description.zh-cn: 天安门是“北京中轴线”的组成部分。
description.en: Tiananmen is a component of the 'Central Axis of Beijing'.

description.zh-cn: 2024年7月27日，北京中轴线入选世界遗产名录。
description.en: On July 27, 2024, the Central Axis of Beijing was inscribed on the World Heritage List.

description.zh-cn: 1966年的邢台大地震对天安门的建筑结构造成了影响，促使其在1970年进行了秘密重建。
description.en: The 1966 Xingtai earthquake affected the structure of Tiananmen, prompting its secret reconstruction in 1970.

description.zh-cn: 1928年，国民革命军北伐统一后，天安门首次挂上孙中山的肖像。
description.en: In 1928, after the unification of the Northern Expedition by the National Revolutionary Army, a portrait of Sun Yat-sen was hung on Tiananmen for the first time.

description.zh-cn: 抗日战争胜利后至1949年，天安门城楼上悬挂着时任国民政府主席蒋中正的肖像。
description.en: From the end of the Second Sino-Japanese War until 1949, a portrait of then Chairman of the Nationalist Government, Chiang Kai-shek, was hung on the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 自1949年中华人民共和国成立以来，毛泽东的巨幅肖像一直悬挂于天安门城楼。
description.en: Since the founding of the People's Republic of China in 1949, a large portrait of Mao Zedong has been hung on the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 1953年3月9日，为追悼苏联领导人史达林，天安门城楼上的毛泽东肖像被更换为史达林肖像一天。
description.en: On March 9, 1953, to mourn the Soviet leader Joseph Stalin, the portrait of Mao Zedong on the Tiananmen gate was replaced with a portrait of Stalin for one day.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日，余志坚与另外两人向悬挂在天安门的毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料。
description.en: On May 23, 1989, Yu Zhijian and two others threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong hanging on Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日，喻东岳与另外两人向悬挂在天安门的毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料。
description.en: On May 23, 1989, Yu Dongyue and two others threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong hanging on Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 1989年5月23日，鲁德成与另外两人向悬挂在天安门的毛泽东肖像泼洒颜料。
description.en: On May 23, 1989, Lu Decheng and two others threw paint at the portrait of Mao Zedong hanging on Tiananmen.

relationships.source: 天安门金水桥恐怖袭击案

description.zh-cn: 2013年10月28日，恐怖分子驾车冲撞天安门金水桥护栏，对该地标造成了物理冲击和破坏。
description.en: On October 28, 2013, terrorists drove a vehicle into the guardrails of the Jinshui Bridge at Tiananmen, causing physical impact and damage to the landmark.

description.zh-cn: 1912年2月12日，隆裕太后在天安门颁布了《宣统帝退位诏书》。
description.en: On February 12, 1912, Empress Dowager Longyu issued the 'Imperial Edict of the Abdication of the Xuantong Emperor' at Tiananmen.

description.zh-cn: 该诏书的颁布标志着清朝末代皇帝爱新觉罗溥仪正式退位。
description.en: The issuance of this edict marked the official abdication of Aisin-Gioro Puyi, the last emperor of the Qing dynasty.

relationships.target: 中华人民共和国中央人民政府 (1949年－1954年)

description.zh-cn: 毛泽东在天安门城楼上宣布中华人民共和国中央人民政府成立。
description.en: Mao Zedong announced the establishment of the Central People's Government of the People's Republic of China from the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 文化大革命期间，毛泽东在天安门城楼八次接见来自全国各地的红卫兵。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Mao Zedong met with Red Guards from all over the country eight times on the Tiananmen gate.

description.zh-cn: 在文化大革命期间，天安门成为毛泽东接见红卫兵和举行大型群众集会的场所，进一步强化了其政治符号意义。
description.en: During the Cultural Revolution, Tiananmen became a venue for Mao Zedong to receive Red Guards and hold large-scale mass rallies, further strengthening its political symbolism.

description.zh-cn: 1919年的“五四运动”在天安门广场爆发，使其成为中国现代史上学生爱国运动的标志性地点。
description.en: The 'May Fourth Movement' of 1919 broke out in Tiananmen Square, making it a landmark location for student patriotic movements in modern Chinese history.

description.zh-cn: 1976年的“四五运动”在天安门广场发生，是悼念周恩来、反对“四人帮”的群众性运动。
description.en: The '1976 Tiananmen Incident' took place in Tiananmen Square as a mass movement to mourn Zhou Enlai and oppose the 'Gang of Four'.

description.zh-cn: 1989年的“六四天安门事件”主要发生在天安门广场及其周边地区。
description.en: The '1989 Tiananmen Square protests' mainly occurred in and around Tiananmen Square.

description.zh-cn: 第二套人民币的一元券背面图案采用了天安门。
description.en: The design of Tiananmen was used on the reverse of the one-yuan note of the second series of Renminbi.
